id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID used for code generation.

*See also: [LCD Menu](https://esphome.io/components/display_menu/lcd_menu.html#overview)*

display_id.docs:
**[ID](https://esphome.io/guides/configuration-types.html#config-id)**: Manually specify the ID of the LCD display.

*See also: [LCD Menu](https://esphome.io/components/display_menu/lcd_menu.html#overview)*

mark_selected.docs:
**0-255**: Code of the character used to mark menu item selected. Defaults to `0x3e` (`>`).

*See also: [LCD Menu](https://esphome.io/components/display_menu/lcd_menu.html#overview)*

mark_editing.docs:
**0-255**: Code of the character used to mark menu item editing mode. Defaults to `0x2a` (`*`).

*See also: [LCD Menu](https://esphome.io/components/display_menu/lcd_menu.html#overview)*

mark_submenu.docs:
**0-255**: Code of the character used to mark menu item leading to a submenu. Defaults to `0x7e` (a right arrow).

*See also: [LCD Menu](https://esphome.io/components/display_menu/lcd_menu.html#overview)*

mark_back.docs:
**0-255**: Code of the character used to mark menu items going back one level. As the character set lacks a good looking up arrow, using a user defined character is advisable (use `8` to reference one at  position `0` to avoid problems with zeros in a string). Defaults to `0x5e` (`^`).

*See also: [LCD Menu](https://esphome.io/components/display_menu/lcd_menu.html#overview)*
